headline.main: Afghans Wait For Portents In Bonn Talks

lead_paragraph: With the Northern Alliance suddenly dominating much of Afghanistan, the effort to define the country's future is beginning to turn from a military phase to a political one. While the Taliban home base of Kandahar and the hunt for Osama bin Laden will continue to be the focus of American attention, a vast majority of Afghans will be watching negotiations that start in Germany on Tuesday and that could determine whether their country reverts to civil war or unites in a new era of stability.
abstract: Effort to define Afghanistan' future turns from military to political phase with Taliban in retreat and Northern Alliance dominating much of country; vast majority of Afghans will be focused on negotiations, scheduled for November 27 in Bonn, Germany, that could determine whether country reverts to civil war or unites in new era of stability (M)
